p: Still addressing activities on CNS, an aqueous extract of Cantinoa americana (syn. Hyptis spicigera) demonstrated anti-convulsant and sedative effects. The extract was capable of protecting 100 and 87.5% of mice against strychnine and pentylenetetrazol induced convulsions, respectively (160Â mg/kg). In addition, the ability to increase total sleep duration induced by diazepam was also observed, representing a potent sedative effect ( Bum et al., 2009). In addition, Almeida et al. (2018) evaluated the anti-acetylcholinesterase effect of the essential oil from the leaves of Hyptis dilatata obtaining inhibition rates higher than 96%.
